content: A farmer has a basket of apples and a robot that can sort them based on their weight. The robot can only hold a maximum of 5 apples at a time. The farmer wants to sort all the apples, but doesn't want to overload the robot. The apples weigh as follows: 2 oz, 4 oz, 6 oz, 8 oz, 10 oz, 12 oz, 14 oz, 16 oz, 18 oz, 20 oz. What is the minimum number of times the robot needs to be used to sort all the apples?

To determine the minimum number of times the robot needs to be used to sort all the apples, we must take into account the constraint that the robot can hold a maximum of 5 apples at a time. The apples given are: 2 oz, 4 oz, 6 oz, 8 oz, 10 oz, 12 oz, 14 oz, 16 oz, 18 oz, and 20 oz. There are a total of 10 apples.

Since the robot can handle up to 5 apples at a time, and there are 10 apples in total, we can divide the apples into two groups of 5 apples each. The robot will need to handle each group separately.

Therefore, the minimum number of times the robot needs to be used to sort all the apples is 2.
